# presentationStyle

**Instance Property**

The presentation style to use for the transition.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var presentationStyle: UIModalPresentationStyle { get }
```

## Return Value

The modal presentation style associated with the transition or [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIModalPresentationStyle/none] if the transition is not a modal presentation or dismissal. For a list of possible values, see “Modal Presentation Styles” in [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIViewController].

## Discussion

When presenting or dismissing a view controller modally, this method returns the presentation style used for that transition. For interface rotations and other events that don’t involve a specific transition between view controllers, this method returns [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIModalPresentationStyle/none].

## Getting the behavior attributes

- **transitionDuration**: Returns the noninteractive duration of a transition.
- **completionCurve**: Returns the completion curve associated with the transition.
- **completionVelocity**: Returns the starting velocity to use for any final animations.
- **percentComplete**: Returns the percentage of completion for an interactive transition when it moves to its noninteractive phase.
